page.title: 09TRANSPORT IN CHURCH FENTON
page.content: Although Church Fenton is a{rural {area,}we found that most people do not feel isolated. Generally this is because they own a car,(their main form of travel) but also because the village is served by{public transport, consisting of daily bus and rail services. Few people use the{bus service regularly. Reasons given are: it is expensive, buses are too infrequent and choice of destination is too limited. The{rail service}seems to be used more frequently. About 80 people use it each day. Many are from surrounding villages without a station and about half from the RAF base. Reasons for travelling by rail are: it is cheaper, faster or more reliable than other transport.The most popular destination is York.
